body: you're the first asking for this, let's see if more people are interested...

https://github.com/goreleaser/archive/issues/4 

By the way, I found a problem with packing files in subdirectories. I want to pack all the files and files in directories in `templates` directory, but it will only pack the `home.html` file and empty directories. 

```yaml
archive:
  name_template: '{{ .ProjectName }}_{{ .Os }}_{{ .Arch }}{{ if .Arm }}v{{ .Arm }}{{ end }}'
  replacements:
    darwin: Darwin
    linux: Linux
    windows: Windows
    386: i386
    amd64: x86_64
  format_overrides:
  - goos: windows
    format: zip
  wrap_in_directory: true
  files:
    - LICENSE
    - README.md
    - README-en.md
    - templates/*
```

```bash
templates
├── base
│   └── base.html
├── client
│   └── client.html
├── server
│   ├── login.html
│   └── server.html
└── home.html
```
I tried but it did not work.
Thanks. It works now. But I why `templates/**` does not work?
It's just how globs work, if you try for example `ls templates/**` and `ls templates/**/*` you'll see the difference... It was my fault I gave you the wrong answer first hehe

There is still a problem. When I enabled `wrap_in_directory`, the extraction on my vps was abnormal. Something wrong with `\` and `\\`.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7992620/43067550-3aab11be-8e9a-11e8-826c-a6130133eb42.png)
